arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss left frustrated at lack of end product in 3-0 loss to Peterborough
arts.sum: Posh’s opening goal on 38 minutes came after Charlton keeper Will Mannion was penalised for picking up Kayne Ramsay’s backpass. The latest meeting was an open affair but that suited Peterborough more as they hurt their opponents time and again on transition moments.

arts.ttl: Peterborough ease relegation fears with win over Charlton
arts.sum: Sam Hughes, Abraham Odoh and Malik Mothersille scored in a comfortable 3-0 victory.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic hand long-term deal to teenage prospect
arts.sum: Kai Enslin has signed a new contract at Charlton Athletic. “He’s very good technically and he’s a really intelligent footballer who has real versatility.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic hand short-term deal to Australian goalkeeper
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic have signed goalkeeper Dean Bouzanis on a short-term contract. Bouzanis said: “It’s an honour to be here and an opportunity that I’m looking forward to with this fantastic group that’s fighting at the right end of the table.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic defender could be celebrating back-to-back League One promotions
arts.sum: “It was a killer,” said McIntyre. “It was a dream come true – I had a season ticket since I was four,” said McIntyre.

arts.ttl: ‘I had to mature quickly mentally’ - Charlton Athletic striker Miles Leaburn on facing injury challenge
arts.sum: He said: “My main focus has been staying fit and doing everything in my power to give my body that chance of not picking up any niggles or injuries. Charlton striker Miles Leaburn has opened up over the mental battle – as well as the physical hard graft – that has gone into his recovery from a serious hamstring injury.

arts.ttl: Clean sheet numbers HAD to go up for Charlton Athletic to have successful League One campaign
arts.sum: Jones told the South London Press : “Last season, as a club, we kept five clean sheets in all competitions – that is not going to achieve anything significant. Jones has talked recently about his Charlton players making sacrifices on rest days to ensure they are ready for the League One run-in.
